keyword: how many calories are in one fried egg
title: How Many Calories Are in One Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in one fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown per egg with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in One Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp vegetable oil or butter, no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, brand, cooking method, amount of added fat, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg contains about 92 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 slice of cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories are in one fried egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 92 kcal for one large fried egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying an egg add more calories than boiling?
faqs.a: Yes, frying adds ~14 kcal from the oil or butter compared to a boiled egg's 78 kcal.

faqs.q: How much fat is in one fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 7.5 g total fat, including 2 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Yes, use a non-stick pan with no added fat to drop it to about 72 kcal.
